title: Font ID: Ocean House Stationary Fonts
content:
This is super lovely work by Mucca Design printed by Studio on Fire. Less is truly more because this simple design needs no more or less— it’s perfect!

[http://www.beastpieces.com/2009/03/ocean-house-stationery-mucca-design/\_...](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150007/http:/www.beastpieces.com/2009/03/ocean-house-stationery-mucca-design/_0003_mucca_oceanhouse_business_card/ "http://www.beastpieces.com/2009/03/ocean-house-stationery-mucca-design/\_0003\_mucca\_oceanhouse\_business\_card/")

Do you know the fonts? At first I thought the nameplate was set in Clifford, but this font is a little more narrower. The others are too small for me to recognize. I’m not that good with the classics. I was thinking something like Kis or Freight or Alisal.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150007im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_0005_mucca_oceanhouse_logo_4010.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150007im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_0003_mucca_oceanhouse_business_card_4260.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150007im_/http:/typophile.com/files/_0004_mucca_oceanhouse_detail_4481.jpg)

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content:
Looks letterpress Caslon to me, [here’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20090826150007/http:/www.piccolopress.co.uk/usa-letterpress/Desktop-Pages/Image28.html) another example, but I’ll take a closer look at my Caslon 12pt metal typeface when I get home and report back:)

—- Tamas Ferencz —-

Freight Display is the closest I could find.  
At least I’d put it in the Dutch Old Style category rather than English.
